outputs:
No one owns life, but anyone who can pick up a frying pan owns death. Frying pan in hand, {slayer} smacks {slain} with full force, and the Clocktower is now stained with the Demon's blood. Congratulations! The Demon has been slayed by our brave Dragon Sla-- oh wait, sorry, it's *Demon* Slayer.
Player {slain} is now **dead**.

According to most studies, people's number one fear is public speaking. Number two is death. Death is number two! Does that sound right? This means to the average person, if you go to a funeral, you're better off in the casket than doing the eulogy. And the casket was where {slayer} decided to send {slain}.
Player {slain} is now **dead**.

{slayer} suddenly pulled out their gun, and to everyone's great surprise, aimed carelessly at the roof and fired. The bullet ricocheted around the room before finally hitting {slain}. Luckily, they were the demon all along!
Player {slain} is now **dead**.

According to all known laws of aviation, a bee should never be able to fly. The same priniciples applied to {slain}, who was teleported by {slayer} around 10000 meters above the ground. They didn't stick the landing. After they fell, the village looked at the crater, finding a very dead Demon on the ground.
Player {slain} is now **dead**.

{slayer} launched themself towards {slain}, but tripped instead. As they got up awkwardly, they mumbled, 'I didn't trip. The floor gave me a dirty look, so I attacked it instead.'
Player {slain} is still **alive**.

While counting the 10 duel commandments, {slayer} suddenly recalled their affinity for prime numbers. Profiting from this brief moment of confusion, {slain} quickly backed away and disappeared from view into the forest. Only hours later did the townsfolks finally help {slayer} snap out of his prime number reciting trance.
Player {slain} is still **alive**.

{slayer} pulled out a gun, and shot at {slain}. But some dust got into {slayer}'s eye, and they missed.
Player {slain} is still **alive**.

*As the knocker-up made their rounds in the morning, they discovered that one of the cottages was empty. Further inspection revealed a trail of blood and claw marks within the small house. A carcass, swarming with flies, was discovered a few hours later by the river.*

 {} {} *has died during the night.*

*As the town woke, people started noticing that one of their number had not awakened. Upon further investigation, the village found a dead body, covered in scratches and wounds.*

{} {} *has died during the night.*

'n/Player drank some really spoiled milk, and has passed away in the outhouse. *

{} {} *has died in the night.*

A scream was yelled out in the middle of the night, but no one heard them. When day broke, The villagers saw '/nPlayer's corpse, riddled with wounds and scratches. It was horrifying. *

{} {} *has died during the night.*
The Serial Killer isn't a real role, right? *Cause {} and {} have died.*
The sound of a lone wolf howl echoed through the valley, but no bodies were recovered nor were any people reported missing.
Huh. Seems like nothing's happened in the night. Good job! *No one's dead.*
Ok, this is kinda creepy. *No one died last night.*
Sorry, fell asleep, what's going on? What? *No one died?* Well, you heard them.

The village screams for *

{} {}'s **death**, and the executioner is more than happy to oblige.

A festival was held in *

{} {}'s honor. Unfortunately, *

{} {}'s was stabbed during this, but they already died because of the absolutely boring speeches before hand. *

{} {} is now *dead.*

lore.storyteller_death: *During a hellish thunderstorm, on the stroke of midnight, there echoes a bone-chilling scream. The townsfolk found the town storyteller murdered, their body impaled on the hands of the clocktower. It is your duty to avenge the Storyteller's death by klling the Demon!*

gameplay.tb_lore: *Clouds roll in over Ravenswood Bluff, engulfing this sleepy town and its superstitious inhabitants in foreboding shadow. Anxious mothers call their children home from play, as thunder begins to clap on the horizon. Those who can read the signs know there is...* ***Trouble Brewing***.

gameplay.nominations_open: **Nominations are now open. Alive Players may use the command `{}nominate <player>` to start a public trial.**

gameplay.time_night: It is currently **nighttime**. The night phase lasts a minimum of `{}` and a maximum of `{}`. There {} **{}** left until dawn.
gameplay.time_dawn: It is currently **dawn**. The dawn phase lasts a minimum of `{}` and a maximum of `{}`. There {} **{}** left until daytime.

gameplay.time_voting: It is currently **daytime**. This is the nominations phase. Votes are being counted right now.
gameplay.time_debate: It is currently **daytime**. You have `{}` for discussion. The voting will start in **{}**.
gameplay.time_nomination: It is currently **daytime**. You have `{}` to nominate someone. The game will progress to the night phase in **{}**.

cmd_warnings.nomination_ongoing: {} {} You may not nominate when a nomination is already ongoing. Please wait until the current trial is over.
cmd_warnings.dm_only: {}Â {} You may not use this command outside of a private DM channel.
cmd_warnings.lobby_only: {} {} You may not use this command outside of the public game text channel.
cmd_warnings.alive_only: {} {} You may not use this command while dead.
cmd_warnings.dead_only: {} {} You may not use this command while alive.
cmd_warnings.day_only: {} {} You may not use this command during the nighttime.
cmd_warnings.night_only: {}Â {} You may not use this command during the daytime.
cmd_warnings.player_not_found: {} {} Player(s) not found. Only usernames, nicknames, mentions, and user IDs, in full or partially, are accepted.
cmd_warnings.no_self_targetting_str: {}Â {}Â You may not choose yourself as one of the targets.
cmd_warnings.except_first_night_str: {}Â {}Â You may not use this ability on the first night.
cmd_warnings.requires_one_target_str: {}Â {}Â You must pick exactly one target for your ability. Note that the separator `and` is a special keyword and allows you to input multiple targets.
cmd_warnings.requires_two_targets_str: {} {} You must pick exactly two targets for your ability. Note that the separator `and` is a special keyword and allows you to input multiple targets.
cmd_warnings.requires_different_targets_str: {} {} You must pick different targets for your ability.
cmd_warnings.changes_not_allowed: {} {} You may not change your action once it is submitted.
cmd_warnings.unique_ability_used: {} {} Your ability is single-use, and you have used it up already.
cmd_warnings.townsquare_loading: {} Generating townsquare image, please wait a moment...
cmd_warnings.whisper_too_long: {} {} The content of your whisper is too long.
cmd_warnings.recipient_blocked: {} Your whisper cannot be delivered because the recipient has blocked me.
cmd_warnings.cannot_be_nominated_again: {} {} {} cannot be nominated, because they have been nominated once today already.
cmd_warnings.cannot_nominate_again: {} {}Â You cannot nominate more than once per day.

frole.brief: set a player's role to a specified one
frole.help: This debugging command changes a player's role to one that you specify. The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. The role name can also be typed in full or partially.

modkill.help: This debugging command modkills a specified player. The player will remain in the game, but as a dead player. The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially.
modkill.feedback: {} Successfully modkilled {} with the character of {} `{}`.

fstop.brief: stop a game that is currently running
fstop.help: This debugging command forcefully stops a game that is currently running.

fnight.brief: change the game's phase to Nighttime
fnight.help: This debugging command forcefully transitions the game from the Daytime phase to the Nighttime phase.
fnight.feedback: {} Successfully transitioned to the Night Phase.

fnomination.brief: start the nominations if it's daytime
fnomination.help: This debugging command forcefully fast-forwards the game from the Daytime base phase to the nominations phase.

serve.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in DM.

poison.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in DM.

learn.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in DM.

read.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in DM.

kill.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in DM.

slay.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in the public game text channel.

protect.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in DM.

nominate.help: The bot recognizes usernames, nicknames, user ID's and mentions, typed in full or partially. If your role allows for multiple targets, use 'and' to separate each of them. Please use the command in the public game text channel.

townsquare.help: The "Townsquare" is a graphical representation of the players' circular sitting order, and provides information such as vote availability and player life or death states.

whisper.help: Whispers between players will be relayed by the bot using private messages.

time.help: The game is divided into several stages and phases. Use this command to view the time remaining until the next stage or phase.

stats.help: The game statistics board contains information about player life or death states, the sitting order, and pending executions.
